name: First Conflict Tutorial
description: Guided tutorial showing how smart devices can cooperate or collide, with a guaranteed 'first disaster' and resolution
learning_objectives: Understand that more AI â‰  automatically better
Learn to use governance rules to resolve conflicts
Experience the importance of device coordination

tutorial_sequence.title: Welcome to AI Habitat!
tutorial_sequence.description: You've just set up three smart devices in your living room. Watch how they interact...
tutorial_sequence.expected_behavior: Devices start in harmony, all working toward their individual goals

tutorial_sequence.title: Morning Routine Begins
tutorial_sequence.description: It's 8:00 AM and the temperature is low. Watch what happens...
tutorial_sequence.expected_behavior: AC starts heating, Lamp brightens for morning ambiance, Sofa adjusts for comfort

tutorial_sequence.title: The Conflict Emerges
tutorial_sequence.description: Notice how the devices start competing instead of cooperating...
tutorial_sequence.expected_behavior: Efficiency-first policy causes AC and Lamp to compete, reducing overall comfort

conflict_scenario.description: AC wants to heat efficiently (low power), Lamp wants to brighten for mood (high power), Sofa wants to adjust but can't coordinate
conflict_scenario.manifestation: Temperature oscillates, lighting flickers, user comfort decreases

tutorial_sequence.title: Why Did This Happen?
tutorial_sequence.description: The devices aren't cooperating because Efficiency is prioritized over Comfort. Let's fix this!

explanation.cause: Priority order puts Efficiency first, so each device optimizes individually
explanation.lesson: More AI devices doesn't automatically mean better results

tutorial_sequence.title: Try Comfort > Efficiency
tutorial_sequence.description: Drag 'Comfort' above 'Efficiency' in the priority list and see what happens!
tutorial_sequence.hint: Click and drag 'Comfort' to the top of the priority list

tutorial_sequence.title: Cooperation Emerges!
tutorial_sequence.description: Watch how the same devices now work together beautifully...
tutorial_sequence.expected_behavior: AC heats gradually, Lamp provides complementary warmth via color, Sofa adjusts firmness for cold-weather comfort
cooperation_examples: AC heats gently while Lamp uses warm colors to enhance perceived temperature
Sofa coordinates with AC, becoming firmer as room warms up
All devices communicate their intentions to avoid conflicts

tutorial_sequence.title: Tutorial Complete!
tutorial_sequence.description: Congratulations! You've learned how governance rules can turn device chaos into harmony.
key_lessons: More AI devices can create conflicts without proper coordination
1+1+1 can equal >3, =3, or <3 depending on how they're governed
Simple rule changes (like priority reordering) can dramatically improve outcomes
The goal is harmony, not just individual device optimization
next_steps: Try the Free Sandbox to experiment with more devices
Create your own smart devices and see how they interact

failure_conditions.message: Tutorial took too long - devices may not be responding properly
Expected conflict didn't occur - check device configurations

educational_notes.core_insight: This tutorial demonstrates the fundamental AI Habitat principle: coordination and governance matter more than individual intelligence
educational_notes.real_world_parallel: Like city traffic, individual optimization (everyone going fastest) leads to gridlock, but coordination (traffic lights, rules) creates flow
educational_notes.technical_learning: Students see utility-based conflict resolution, emergent behavior, and the importance of multi-agent coordination
educational_notes.engagement_hook: The 'disaster' is actually fun to watch - it's not a failure but a teaching moment about complexity
